title: Everything Coming To Australian Netflix This Week (September 16)
text:
Image: Supplied

Here is your Netflix binge-list for the week, fresh from the Australian servers! This week's highlights include new episodes of Matt Groening's Disenchantment, cat-and-mouse police interrogation drama Criminal, the self-explanatory Between Two Ferns: The Movie and Bill Gates documentary Inside Bill's Brain. Here's the (somewhat meagre) list for the week of September 16 to September 22.

Netflix is pretty light on content this week, especially when it comes to cool, big-budget genre stuff. (We did warn you.)

Ditch Netflix In September (You Won't Be Sorry) Netflix Australia is about to enter one of its worst dry spells since launch. In September 2019, the service is only adding three new original movies (none of which look like much cop.) With the possible exception of The Politician, there aren't any big 'tent-pole' style series to get excited about either. Read more

The biggest release is probably Disenchantment, a fantasy-flavoured animated series from the creator of Futurama and The Simpsons. Then there's Zach Galifianakis' Between Two Ferns: The Movie which does exactly what it says on the tin. (We remain dubious that these short skits can be stretched out to 90-odd minutes, but fingers crossed eh?)

Fans of Orange Is The New Black may also want to check out Vis a vis (AKA Locked Up) which deals with a similar premise. But otherwise, the pickings are pretty slim this week - maybe check out what's on Stan, Foxtel or Amazom Prime Video instead.

Here are the official synopses and trailers for each film and TV show.

New Netflix TV Shows

When the Camellia Blooms (18 September)

When the Camellia Blooms is a story of Dongbaek, an orphan who grew up to become a single mom. She owns a small bar, also called ‘Dongbaek’ which means camellia in English. Her life takes a new turn after meeting Yongsik, a do-gooder police officer in their small town.

Las del hockey (20 September)

The passionate members of a women's roller-hockey team strive to keep their team afloat.

Criminal (20 September)

Criminal is a police procedural with a unique premise: it takes place exclusively within the confines of a police interview suite.

Disenchantment: Part 2 (20 September)

Manjunath Kumar, fourteen, knows he is good at cricket - if not as good as his elder brother Radha. When Manju begins to get to know Radha's great rival, a boy as privileged and confident as Manju is not, everything in Manju's world begins to change and he is faced with decisions that will change both his sense of self and of the world around him.

Fastest Car: Season 2 (20 September)

Extremely expensive supercars take on massively modified undercover speed demons, including Hondas, Fords, Oldsmobiles and even a Mini Cooper.

Vis a vis / Locked Up: Season 4 (20 September)

A new director and a jailer-turned-inmate arrive at Cruz del Norte. Zulema is reunited with a long-lost relative, while Sole gets life-changing news.

Vagabond

Vagabond is a story about a stuntman Cha Dal-geon, played by Lee Seung-gi, who gets involved in a tragic airplane crash and ends up discovering a national corruption scandal in the process.

New Netflix Movies

Netflix Originals

Between Two Ferns: The Movie (20 September)

Zach Galifianakis dreamed of becoming a star. But when Will Ferrell discovered his public access TV show "Between Two Ferns" and uploaded it to Funny or Die, Zach became a viral laughing stock. Now Zach and his crew are taking a road trip to complete a series of high-profile celebrity interviews and restore his reputation.

Licensed

Under the Eiffel Tower (23 September)

Stuart is a having a mid-life crisis. Desperate for something more in life, he tags along on his best friend's family vacation to Paris - then proposes to his friend's 26-year-old daughter, Rosalind, while standing under the Eiffel Tower.

Netflix Documentary & Comedy

Inside Bill's Brain: Decoding Bill Gates (20 September)

A new three-part documentary that explores the mind and motivations of celebrated tech visionary, business leader, and philanthropist Bill Gates. The series, in-depth and unfiltered in its depiction of a man's life journey, both his triumphs and setbacks, offers unprecedented access to Gates as he pursues unique solutions to some of the world’s most complex problems with the same level of optimism, curiosity, and fervor that inspired his original vision for Microsoft. Interweaving these endeavors with personal moments, Inside Bill’s Brain draws on interviews with Bill and Melinda Gates in addition to their friends, family, and partners in philanthropy and business, creating an innovative and revealing portrait of a man who, after changing the world, might just change the way others see it.

Kids & Anime

The Last Kids on Earth (17 September)

When zombies and monsters invade his hometown, a scrappy boy teams up with his friends to survive the apocalypse. Based on the popular book series.
